questions.question_text: Which of the following are functions of the model category? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Model categories provide the link between configuration management and asset management
choices.E: Model categories provide the link between procurement management and asset management
choices.A: Model categories group consumables in the Product Catalog
choices.B: Model categories determine when to create assets from configuration items (Cls)
choices.C: Model categories group related assets in the Service Catalog

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
Model categories associate CI classes with asset classes. Model categories are part of the Product Catalog application.

The model category configuration determines if the ServiceNow platform creates an asset from a CI, and, if so, what class of asset. Asset classes in the base system are Hardware, Software License, and Consumable.

Selected Answer: BD
BD are correct, checked the sources below

Selected Answer: BD
B and D. https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-it-asset-management/page/product/product-catalog/concept/c_ModelCategories.html

Selected Answer: BD
B. Model categories determine when to create assets from configuration items (CIs): Model categories help define the criteria or conditions under which configuration items are transformed into assets. They specify the rules or triggers that indicate when a configuration item should be converted into an asset in the asset management system.

D. Model categories provide the link between configuration management and asset management: Model categories serve as a connection point between the processes of configuration management and asset management. They help bridge the gap between the two domains by providing a means to associate and manage configuration items as assets within the asset management system.

Selected Answer: BD
Model categories provide more capabilities than simple categorization of assets.
They provide the link between configuration management and asset
management.
Model categories identify when to create CIs from
assets and assets from CIs

questions.question_text: For a model to be fully normalized, what must be added to the model record?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D
The most common cause for models to not fully normalize is missing data in model records. As we learned previously, they key fields for match criteria are Manufacturer, model Name, and Model number. If you run into normalization issues:

Check your model records and ensure your data is complete. If not, add the missing data. 
Check your model records and ensure your data is clean. If not, cleanup your data.
